name: Instant Pot® Chicken Noodle Soup
author: Tim
summary: Simple and fast chicken noodle soup made in the Instant Pot®.
ingredients: 3  carrots, or more to taste, peeled and sliced
3 stalks celery, or more to taste, chopped
½ teaspoon ground black pepper, or to taste
1 pound frozen skinless, boneless chicken breast halves
directions: Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®), select Saute function, and add butter
Add carrots, celery, and onion to the melted butter; saute until soft, 3 to 5 minutes
Stir in thyme, oregano, salt, and pepper
Stir in chicken broth, water, bouillon cubes, and bay leaves
Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 12 minutes
Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build
Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, 10 minutes
Switch to the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes
Carefully chop or shred the meat, and add back to the pot
Select Saute function and add egg noodles
Cook until noodles are tender yet firm to the bite, 8 to 10 minutes
Stir in dried parsley and serve
